files.name: spaceone/api/notification/v1/project_channel.proto
files.description: A ProjectChannel is a destination  where Notifications are delivered. Notifications are generated via the Protocol set by each Project.

fields.name: protocol_id
fields.description: The ID of protocol that will be set in project channel.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of Project Channel. It can have a maximum of 255 characters.

fields.name: data
fields.description:
The data for using project channel.
This data is encrypted and stored in the Secret service if JSON schema in the protocol's metadata is set to SECRET type.
In this case, the secret ID that is stored in the security service will be returned and the data value will be empty.
if JSON schema in the protocol's metadata is set to PLAIN_TEXT type, This data is not encrypted and stored directly in the DB.

fields.name: is_subscribe
fields.description:
Indicates whether subscriptions will be used.
+optional

fields.name: subscriptions
fields.description:
When using subscriptions, it indicates the topic list to subscription.
If is_subscribe is set to false, this value is ignored.
+optional
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: notification_level
fields.description:
Set the level of notification.
If a notification has a level and a notification level that this channel can receive is set, a notification is dispatched only if the notification level is the same.
+optional

fields.name: is_scheduled
fields.description:
Indicates whether schedule will be used.
+optional

fields.name: schedule
fields.description:
Schedule for which you want to receive notifications through the project channel.
+optional

fields.name: tags
fields.description:
The tags for project channel.
+optional

fields.name: project_id
fields.description: The ID of project to which the project channel belongs.

fields.name: domain_id
fields.description: The ID of domain.

fields.name: project_channel_id
fields.description: The ID of project channel.

fields.name: domain_id
fields.description: The ID of domain.

fields.name: only
fields.description:
The list of the project channel information column you want to be returned. It must be specified in the ProjectChannelInfo.
+optional
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: project_channel_id
fields.description: The ID of project channel.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of project channel

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of project channel. ENABLED or DISABLED only.

fields.name: data
fields.description: The data for using project channel.

fields.description: The ID of secret encrypted data in the security service

fields.name: day_of_week
fields.description:
Day of the week to be notified.
As a list type, only types that can be specified from MON to SUN can be set.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: start_hour
fields.description:
Start time to receive notifications.
Only integer type can be set, and 0 to 23 can be.

fields.name: end_hour
fields.description:
End time to receive notifications.
Only integer type can be set, and 1 to 24 can be.

fields.description: Statistics Query format provided by SpaceONE. Please check the link for more information.

fields.description: Total counts of queried project channels.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a new ProjectChannel. ProjectChannel is a channel that delivers a Notification to the Project when the Notification is created. When creating a ProjectChannel, one Protocol must be selected, and a Notification is dispatched via the selected Protocol.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates a specific ProjectChannel. A ProjectChannel that has already been configured cannot be changed. Instead, the data required for dispatching Notifications to a ProjectChannel can be updated.

methods.name: set_schedule
methods.description: Sets a schedule for a ProjectChannel. A schedule defines the time to receive a Notification. When a Notification is created, you can set the day of the week and time you want to receive it. When you set the day of the week, you can receive a notification only on the day of the week you set. If you also set the start time and end time with the day of the week, you can receive a Notification only at the scheduled time on the day of the week you set. If there is no schedule set in a ProjectChannel, Notifications will be dispatched at all times via the ProjectChannel.

methods.name: set_subscription
methods.description: Sets a subscription for a ProjectChannel. A subscription is a topic for channels to subscribe to and get notified about. If a ProjectChannel has subscriptions, a Notification is dispatched only if the topic of the Notification is the same as the one set in the subscriptions. If there is no subscription in a ProjectChannel, all Notifications will be dispatched.

methods.name: enable
methods.description: Enables a specific ProjectChannel. If a ProjectChannel is enabled, the ProjectChannel can be used and the Notification can be dispatched. Even if a ProjectChannel is enabled, if the Protocol used in the ProjectChannel is disabled, the Notification is not dispatched.

methods.name: disable
methods.description: Disables a specific ProjectChannel. If a ProjectChannel is disabled, the Notification is not dispatched, even if it is created.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Gets a specific ProjectChannel. Prints detailed information about the ProjectChannel.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Gets a list of all ProjectChannels. You can use a query to get a filtered list of ProjectChannels.

scalarValueTypes.notes: Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s.
Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28.
Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56.
A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text.
May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes.
